ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Demonstrates how to change the type of a RenderableSeries (e.g. change Line to Column, to Mountain) using the SciChart API
ExampleDefinition.Description:
Demonstrates how to change how a series type is rendered in code. This is achieved by manipulating the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v4.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.SciChartSurface~RenderableSeries.html']SciChartSurface.RenderableSeries[/url] collection at runtime. The same thing can be achieved in MVVM, using our new MVVM [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v4.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Common.MarkupExtensions.SeriesBinding.html']SeriesBinding[/url] Markup Extension.
Click on a series to select it. With the series selected, change the Series Type via the dropdown.
[i][b]Note:[/b][/i] [i]this example uses the HitTest API with interpolation to allow selecting of a series via mouse-click anywhere on the line, column or area.[/i]
